alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:33AM CDT until July 12 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN KEOKUK...WESTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHEASTERN BENTON... NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN LINN AND SOUTHEASTERN IOWA COUNTIES... At 833 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Walford to Cosgrove to near Wellman, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, Coralville, North Liberty, Williamsburg, Kalona, Fairfax, Tiffin, Ely, Walford, Wellman, North English, Riverside, Swisher, Oxford, What Cheer, Shueyville, Norway, Keswick and South English. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
